title: Clue scroll (master)

properties.name: description
properties.value: A clue scroll (master) is the highest tier of clue scroll.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Clue scroll (master)
 This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
Clue scroll (master)
Released6 July 2016 (Update)
MembersYes
Quest itemNo
Properties
TradeableNo
EquipableNo
StackableNo

Advanced data
Item ID19835

A clue scroll (master) is the highest tier of clue scroll.

Players can obtain a master clue scroll from the following methods:

  • By bringing one each of the easy, medium, hard and elite clue scrolls to Watson, who is located in the large, fenced-in house west of the Forthos Ruin in Hosidius. It should be noted that if you have an incomplete master scroll and attempt to obtain a new scroll, Watson will take all lower tier scrolls but NOT give you a master scroll until either you complete the original scroll or discard it.
  • As a potential reward from completing any easy, medium, hard or elite treasure trails, with the chances of obtaining them being 1/50, 1/30, 1/15, and 1/5 respectively.

Like elite and hard clue scrolls, master clue scrolls also have combat encounters. They include a Brassican Mage, double agent or three Ancient Wizards (in multi-combat areas). As their tier suggests, master clues require numerous high-levelled items, requirements, and quests in order to complete them.

It should be noted, that if a player dies in the Wilderness with a clue scroll in above level 20, it will disappear whether it's a PvP death or not, unless it is an item kept on death, or if that player has a clue box. Players will find that the clue scroll will be gone upon returning to their loot otherwise. However, when dying in the Wilderness with a clue box, provided the player returns quick enough, the clue will stay in the inventory while the clue box is lost. Players may find it beneficial to carry a Wilderness Sword (to cut webs), Royal Seed Pod/Teleport Crystal and/or an Explorer's Ring, as clue scrolls are always kept above these items; these however will be lost upon death and duplicates are easily obtainable. In lower wilderness however (level 20 or lower) in PvP death, the unprotected clue will stay on the ground for up to 1 hour. The same goes for reward caskets. If you die in lower Wilderness due to a monster you will always keep the clue whether protected or not.

Master clue scrolls can be between 6 and 8 steps long, and give a master reward casket upon completion.

Types of clues[edit | edit source]

Please note that it is possible to receive the same clue more than once.

  • Falo the Bard
  • Sherlock
  • Anagrams
  • Coordinates
  • Puzzle box
  • Light box
  • Cryptic clues
  • Emote clues
  • Hot & Cold

Requirements[edit | edit source]

Skill requirements

Certain clues will require items that need a certain skill requirement in order to wear, wield or access. The table below shows the highest skill requirement, in order to complete every master clue. Quest skill requirements are not noted in this table. Sherlock may also give you skill challenges which require certain skill levels to complete. Temporary skill boosts can be used for non-combat skill challenges.

Skill level Details
80 Required to complete a lap of the Rellekka Rooftop Course with full graceful outfit.
75 Required to wield godswords and Arclight.
72 Required to dissect a sacred eel.
87 Required to craft a light orb.
70 Required to wear Barrows armour.
85 Required to plant spirit saplings and to enter the high tier of the Farming Guild.
90 Required to light redwood logs.
87 Required to fish a sacred eel.
81 Required to fletch rune darts.
87 Required to make anti-venom.
70 Required to cross the river into Zamorak's Fortress in the God Wars Dungeon.
90 Required to cast Master Reanimation.
85 Required to mine runite ore with full prospector kit.
70 Required to wear black dragonhide armour, crystal bow, and Karil's equipment.[r 1]
77 Required to runecraft blood runes.
88 Required to smith a rune med helm.
85 Required to kill a reanimated abyssal.
70 Required to equip Torag's hammers and Dharok's greataxe.[r 1]
85 Required to pickpocket an elf.
90 Required to cut a redwood tree with full lumberjack outfit.
  1. ^ 1.0 1.1 An emote clue requires any Barrows equipment set.

Quest requirements[edit | edit source]

Some clues require access to areas or NPCs which may require quests. Some only require to start the quest in order to gain access.

Quest Details
Cold War (partial completion) Required for the clockwork suit and access to the Iceberg.
Curse of the Empty Lord Required to talk to Viggora.
Darkness of Hallowvale Required for access to Meiyerditch.
Desert Treasure Required for access to the Shadow Dungeon and ability to wield Ancient staff. Required for access to the Ice Path.
Dragon Slayer I Required to equip rune platebody.
Dragon Slayer II Required to access Myths' Guild.
Fairytale II - Cure a Queen Required for access to Enchanted Valley.
Family Crest Required to equip cooking gauntlets.
The Fremennik Isles Required to equip helm of neitiznot.
The Fremennik Trials (started) Required to talk to Falo the Bard.
The General's Shadow Required to wear shadow sword.
The Great Brain Robbery Required to wield barrelchest anchor.
Heroes' Quest Required to wield dragon battleaxe.
Icthlarin's Little Helper (started) Required for access to Jalsavrah.
In Aid of the Myreque Required to wield rod of ivandis.
Legends' Quest Required for access to the Legends' Guild, bull roarer, wear cape of legends and dragon sq shield.
Lunar Diplomacy (started) Required to access Lunar Isle.
The Lost Tribe (partial completion) Gives access to Goblin Salute emote.
Making Friends with My Arm Required to talk to Snowflake.
Making History Required to talk to Jorral at his outpost.
Monkey Madness I Required to wield dragon scimitar.
Mourning's End Part II Gives access to the Death Altar and the area around it.
Priest in Peril Required for access to Mort'ton and Barrows.
Recipe for Disaster Required to show Falo the Bard Barrows gloves.
Regicide (started) Required for access to Port Tyras and Zul-Andra.
Roving Elves Required to wield crystal bow.
Royal Trouble Required for access to the Miscellania and Etceteria Dungeon.
Shades of Mort'ton Required to burn a Fiyr remain.
Shadow of the Storm Prerequisite for Arclight.
Song of the Elves Required to access Prifddinas.
Swan Song Required to access Piscatoris Fishing Colony.
Underground Pass Required for Iban's staff and for access to Iban's Temple.
Wanted! Required to wear white armour.

Other requirements[edit | edit source]

Requirement Details
100% Arceuus Favour To bind a blood rune at the Blood Altar, to create a Reanimated abyssal and to create a Barrows teleport tablet.
75% Hosidius Favour To enter the Woodcutting Guild.
100% Piscarilius Favour To catch an anglerfish in Port Piscarilius.
100% Shayzien Favour To kill a Lizardman shaman.
Full angler's outfit To complete a challenge for Sherlock.
Full graceful outfit To complete a challenge for Sherlock.
Full lumberjack outfit To complete a challenge for Sherlock.
Full prospector's outfit To complete a challenge for Sherlock; Varrock armour 4 can be substituted for prospector jacket.
Dragon defender To show Falo the Bard.
Fighter torso To show Falo the Bard.
Fire cape To complete an emote clue.
Infernal axe To show Falo the Bard.

Possible rewards[edit | edit source]

Main article: Reward casket (master)

The average loot roll is worth 127,442. On average, master clues are worth 764,656.

As well as the unique Treasure Trails rewards shown below, players may also receive a variety of other items. A more detailed overview of all possible rewards can be found at reward casket (master).

Image Name

Ornament kits
3rd age equipment (along with all
other 3rd age items)
Gilded equipment (all pieces)
Demon masks
Great Kourend city hoods
Samurai armour
Mummy outfit
Ankou outfit
Robes of darkness
Ring of coins
Left eye patch
Obsidian cape (r)
Fancy tiara
Half moon spectacles
Ale of the gods
Bucket helm (g)
Bowl wig
Bloodhound
Scroll sack

Item sources[edit | edit source]

For an exhaustive list of all known sources for this item, see here (include RDT).
SourceLevelQuantityRarity

Reward casket (elite)N/A 11/5
Reward casket (hard)N/A 11/15
Reward casket (medium)N/A 11/30

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
11 April 2019
(update)

The item was graphically updated.

9 March 2017
(update)

The item's value was increased from 1 to 20.

2 July 2015
(update | poll)

All clue scrolls now have a right-click 'Check steps' option that will allow you to see exactly how many steps you have completed so far.

Players can obtain a master clue scroll from the following methods: *By bringing one each of the [[Clue scroll (easy)|easy]], [[Clue scroll (medium)|medium]], [[Clue scroll (hard)|hard]] and [[Clue scroll (elite)|elite]] clue scrolls to [[Watson]], who is located in the large, fenced-in house west of the [[Forthos Ruin]] in [[Hosidius]]. It should be noted that if you have an incomplete master scroll and attempt to obtain a new scroll, Watson will take all lower tier scrolls but NOT give you a master scroll until either you complete the original scroll or discard it. *As a potential reward from completing any easy, medium, hard or elite treasure trails, with the chances of obtaining them being 1/50, 1/30, 1/15, and 1/5 respectively. Like elite and hard clue scrolls, master clue scrolls also have combat encounters. They include a [[Brassican Mage]], [[double agent]] or three [[Ancient Wizard]]s (in multi-combat areas). As their tier suggests, master clues require numerous high-levelled items, requirements, and [[quests]] in order to complete them. It should be noted, that '''if a player dies in the [[Wilderness]] with a clue scroll in above level 20, it will disappear whether it's a PvP death or not''', unless it is an item kept on death, or if that player has a [[clue box]]. Players will find that the clue scroll will be gone upon returning to their loot otherwise. However, when dying in the Wilderness with a clue box, provided the player returns quick enough, the clue will stay in the inventory while the clue box is lost. Players may find it beneficial to carry a [[Wilderness sword 1|Wilderness Sword]] (to cut webs), [[Royal seed pod|Royal Seed Pod]]/[[Teleport crystal|Teleport Crystal]] and/or an [[Explorer's ring 1|Explorer's Ring]], as clue scrolls are always kept above these items; these however will be lost upon death and duplicates are easily obtainable. In lower wilderness however (level 20 or lower) in PvP death, the unprotected clue will stay on the ground for up to 1 hour. The same goes for reward caskets. If you die in lower Wilderness due to a monster you will always keep the clue whether protected or not.
